items.title: Here’s what you should know about the US TikTok deal
items.summary: A number of investors are competing for the opportunity to purchase the app, and if a deal were to go through, the platform's U.S. business could have its valuation soar to upward of $60 billion.

items.title: Lenovo’s Legion Go S SteamOS gaming handheld with 32GB RAM/1TB SSD hits one of its lowest prices at $713 today
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Lenovo that drops its Ryzen Z1 Extreme-powered Legion Go S PC gaming handheld with SteamOS down to $713.47 shipped. Be sure to enter promo code LENOVONEWYEAR during checkout to see the discounted price. This is regularly a $900 handheld, which is now seeing a $187 discount. The promo code highlighted above drops this handheld down to one of the lowest prices we have tracked for it. It briefly dipped to $650 during Black Friday a couple of months back, and today’s deal puts it within just $63 of that low. It’s a pretty good option to consider if you’re in the market to buy a new gaming handheld, and you can learn more about it below.

more…

items.title: Get up to 70 miles for every hour an EV is connected to Autel’s 80A level 2 charging station at $909 (Reg. $1,299)
items.summary:
The official Autel Amazon storefront is offering the latest and most powerful MaxiCharger AC Pro 80A Level 2 EV Charger for $908.99 shipped, matching its pricing directly from the brand’s website. This newer residential/business EV charging station would normally run you $1,299 without any discounts, which we’ve been seeing riding a Prime-exclusive rate of $1,069 in 2026 so far. Now, you can grab one to step-up your home EV charging game with $390 savings to the second-lowest price we have tracked, only beaten out by the $899 low we last spotted in September 2025.

items.title: Giving your healthcare info to a chatbot is, unsurprisingly, a terrible idea
items.summary: Every week, more than 230 million people ask ChatGPT for health and wellness advice, according to OpenAI. The company says that many see the chatbot as an "ally" to help navigate the maze of insurance, file paperwork, and become better self-advocates. In exchange, it hopes you will trust its chatbot with details about your diagnoses, […]

items.summary: Piper James's body was found on a beach surrounded by dingoes, but a coroner found evidence "consistent with drowning".

items.title: Lectric offers extremely rare price cuts on all e-bikes with some bundled FREE gear for few days – starting from $799 lows
items.summary:
Lectric has launched an unexpected weekend price cut flash sale that is striking $100 off most of its e-bikes, except the premium ONE e-bike with a $500 price cut, as well as some smaller bundle packages up to $220 in size across some series. Things are starting the lowest with the XP Lite2 JW Black Belt-Drive e-bike at $799 shipped, while you’ll have to go with its long-range chain-drive or belt-drive counterparts to also snag some FREE bundled gear. This standard model hardly ever comes with additional FREE gear like the longer-range models, but that lack of extra equipment is offset by the extremely rare $100 discount here that is a first in over a year, marking a new low price as far as we have tracked. Head below to learn more about it, its long-range upgrades, and to browse the full lineup of deals while they last over the next few days.

items.summary:
Spigen Classic Fit D-Buckle Apple Watch Strap

Buy for $27 (Reg. $37)

What we love

This Spigen band manages to standout from the pack in a couple different ways. The sort of patterned fabric strap combines with vegan leather applications, orange stitch details and, perhaps most, eye-catching, the “sleek metal connectors [that] create a bold and elevated look for your watch.” It’s not for everyone, but I quick like the look here, especially the deployant clasp and that $27 Prime shipped price tag.

items.title: How to upgrade to Animal Crossing Switch 2 Edition down at $52, more
items.summary:
If you are, for some reason, one of the only folks out there with a Switch 2 that doesn’t have a copy of Animal Crossing: New Horizons, you might want to consider this deal. Nintendo just recently released the Switch 2 Edition alongside some additional content for the game, but the Switch 2 Edition will run you $65. That’s almost certainly worth it, but you could also scoop up the Switch 1 edition on sale for $44.99 Prime shipped at Woot and then grab the $6.99 upgrade pack from Nintendo to land the same package for $52. Chances are it’s going to be a long while before we see the proper Switch 2 edition down at a price like that. “Animal Crossing: New Horizons – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition features enhanced resolution, mouse control support for faster and easier decorating, a megaphone for calling your animal residents that uses the system microphone, and more.”

items.title: Anker SOLIX winter weekend flash sale drops expanded C1000 gen 1 power station + bag to $729 low, more from $429
items.summary:
As part of its soon-to-end Winter Sale, Anker SOLIX has also launched a 72-hour weekend flash sale that will close out its current savings event, with some notable lows sticking around from the previous flash sale on the F2600 2,560Wh power station and its larger F3800 3,840Wh counterpart. Starting on the lower end of the pricing, you can currently find Anker’s SOLIX C1000 Gen 1 Portable Power Station bundled with an expansion battery and a water-resistant bag for $729 shipped, which beats out its bagless option at Amazon by $141. This package would fetch you $1,898 without any discounts, and hasn’t been featured like this in past sales, instead being split into two separate bundles. Considering the expanded setup has gone as low as $699, and the water-resistant bag on its own has gone as low as $80 (meaning $779 total with their best pricing), this bundle with all three certainly seems to be the lowest price you could score them with, complete with $1,169 savings. There’s also the newer and more compact C1000 Gen 2 Power Station down at $429 shipped, and matching its Amazon pricing. Head below for the full lineup.

more…

items.title: Put your spare M.2 SSD to use with this transparent USB-C enclosure for just $15 (Reg. $25)
items.summary:
ORICO Transparent M.2 2280 NVMe SSD Enclosure

Buy for $15 (Reg. $25)

Clip the on-page 40% off coupon.

What we love

With SSD prices skyrocketing, you might want to put your spare M.2 drives to good use, and this enclosure will let you do just that. Once assembled, it delivers USB-C speeds of up to 10Gb/s via a USB 3.2 Gen 2 connection. It also stands out with a transparent design that looks far more interesting than the usual plain enclosures.

items.summary:
Baseus 100W 6.6-foot USB-C cable with LED

Buy for $9 (Reg. $19)

Enter promo code 59NBVSJD for $5.44 off.

What we love

One of the highlights of this Baseus USB-C cable is the built-in LED display on the connector, which shows real-time power output as you charge. It’s a 6.6-foot braided cable that supports up to 100W fast charging, and handles data speeds up to 480MB/s. It’a an easy recommendation if you’re looking to buy a new cable to charge your devices.

items.title: Pre-orders now live: Nintendo announces release date for new physical Talking Flower collectible
items.summary:
Update: Pre-orders are now live via GameStop on Nintendo’s new Talking Flower at $34.99.

Update: Nintendo has also announced that Super Mario Bros. Wonder – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Meetup in Bellabel Park is launching on on March 26 with new amiibo (Elephant Mario, Captain Toad and Talking Flower, Poplin and Prince Florian). Trailer below.

As part of the Mario Bros. 40th anniversary, Nintendo announced an upcoming expansion for Super Mario Bros. Wonder that is set to release sometime this spring, but it is also releasing a physical collectible known as Talking Flower too. Today it launched an overview trailer for its adorable new Talking Flower, serving up some details on some of its (sort of) smart capabilities and a release date – pre-orders are set to go live today. 

more…

items.title: Keep food/drinks cool or frozen in cars, RVs, boats, more with BougeRV’s 53-quart portable fridge/freezer at $236
items.summary:
Through the official BougeRV Amazon storefront, you can pick up the brand’s 12V 53-Quart Portable Refrigerator/Freezer at $235.99 shipped, or get it with a cover for $54 more. Going for $310 at full price, we’ve mostly seen it hanging down around $250 during the last few months of holidays, with occasional dips to $240 and the first appearance of this same rate post-Cyber Monday, followed by its second appearance as a more short-term Lightning deal. Now, you’re getting a third chance to score it at the best price we have tracked over the last year, thanks to the return of this $74 markdown, making it a more budget-friendly model than its newer dual-zone and wheeled counterpart that is sitting $114 higher, which does still come in lower than some premium brand models.
